alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 8:45PM EDT until August 01 at 3:20PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Bell, Harlan and Leslie. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 845 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harlan, Pineville, Loyall, Evarts, Wallins Creek, Kentenia, Coldiron, Pathfork, Molus, Tremont, Black Snake, Tacky Town, White Star, Blackmont, Liggett, Teetersville, Stony Fork Junction, Elcomb, Mary Alice and Saylor.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
